{{dcl header|optional}}
{{dcl|since=c++17|
template&lt; class T &gt;
optional(T) -&gt; optional&lt;T&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

One [[cpp/language/class template argument deduction|deduction guide]] is provided for {{lc|std::optional}} to account for the edge cases missed by the implicit deduction guides, in particular, non-copyable arguments and array to pointer conversion.
 
===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;optional&gt;
#include &lt;type_traits&gt;

int main()
{
    int a[2];
    std::optional oa{a}; // uses explicit deduction guide
    static_assert(std::is_same_v&lt;decltype(oa), std::optional&lt;int*&gt;&gt; == true);
}
}}
